Message.Title: Creepy Yahoo!
Message.Msg: Yahoo! is getting worse and worse and creepier and creepier. Y! is now email to me my own Y! Finance Message Board Posts. Hey you Y! retards.... I already know that I said.

Topic.Title: Yahoo's Mayer Needs To Focus On The Next Great Thing: Mobile Photo Sharing

Message.Msg: Mobile photo sharing! Get real. I read many of your post and have given them thumbs up. But this!! You are out of touch with what can be done now. BIG THING!!! No friggen way. The next BIG THING will be IBM's Watson.

Topic.Title: What is Yahoo you ask?

Message.Msg: Good point. The media needs to get over this.

Topic.Title: Yahoo's Mayer Needs To Focus On The Next Great Thing: Mobile Photo Sharing

Message.Msg: Mayer will have Yahoo leading mobile in photos by the end of the month.

Topic.Title: What is Yahoo you ask?

Message.Msg: off this board Marissa and get back to work!

Topic.Title: Scott Thompson on Life After Yahoo

Message.Msg: probably had a wart removed and blew it out of proportion. i mean he did fudge his resume, right?

Topic.Title: Mayer inherits a strong Yahoo

Message.Msg: The first thing Mayer will do is retain Ross Levinsohn.

Topic.Title: Scott Thompson on Life After Yahoo

Message.Msg: yes, once in a while if you did it right, you could get to the old board and post, but you could not read anything.#$%$) now they moved the newest ones over here. must be marissa's excellent coding skills in action!

Message.Title: Eric Jackson has lost most credibility and is very petty and bitter!
Message.Msg: I did not think Thompson was a good CEO pick but Jackson's recent article is mean and petty. I also think a pregnant 37 year old "looker" is a bad pick for CEO. YHOO should just be sold but clearly will get now where near what Jackson's previous hype would have led shareholders to expect.

Topic.Title: Scott Thompson on Life After Yahoo

Message.Msg: once in a while you could get to the old board and post, but not read anything. now they moved the newest ones over here.

Topic.Title: Scott Thompson on Life After Yahoo

Message.Msg: yes, it's true. (my full reply was rejected 3 times. )

Topic.Title: Scott Thompson on Life After Yahoo

Message.Msg: replied 4 times all rejected, but still counted. crazy.

Topic.Title: Eric Jackson has lost most credibility and is very petty and bitter!

Message.Msg: he never had any credibility to start with

Topic.Title: Alibaba’s Tmall Woos U.S. Retailers as Chinese Buy Brands

Message.Msg: Mayer will team up with Jack Ma to help bring US products and buyers to Alibaba Group.

Message.Title: Stock would have been
Message.Msg: $16+ with Levensohn, was $18 with Bartz. Now, we're talking about women having it all, babies, etc. Geesh.......absolutely frustrating!!

Message.Title: When David Filo Gets Excited, I Get Excited
Message.Msg: Kara Swisher made an astute observation in this morning’s piece about Marissa Mayer‘s first week on the job as CEO of Yahoo! (YHOO): Image representing David Filo as depicted in C... Image via CrunchBase Mayer’s most critical ally in her early stages appears to be the quiet and retiring Yahoo co-founder David Filo, who emerged to be a vocal supporter of her from the start. That he gave a quote in a press release and did interviews — my nickname for him has long been “Silent Bob” — should say a lot to anyone paying mind. And it is an important morale booster. While the founders of Yahoo have their definite ups and downs, the heart of the company is still with both Filo and also Jerry Yang. Eric Jackson, Contributor

Message.Title: Major hedge funds buying Yahoo
Message.Msg: The largest hedge fund shareholder of Yahoo is Dan Loeb’s Third Point, which had been increasing its holdings up to over 70 million shares of YHOO as Loeb advocated for changes to the company after initiating a 48 million share position in summer 2011. At the end of March, Third Point reported over a billion dollars in Yahoo shares. Perry Capital, managed by the event-driven manager Richard Perry, doubled its stake in YHOO in the fourth quarter of 2011 and added to it further in the first three months of 2012. Perry now owns 13 million shares. Jeffrey Tannenbaum’s Fir Tree Capital did not have a position in Yahoo at the end of 2011, but bought 11.3 million shares in just three months to become another major hedge fund shareholder.

Message.Title: Bidu's earnings bullish for YHOO
Message.Msg: Supportive of Alibaba valuation, which I put at 50-65% of Yahoo's current market cap.

I think every one on the board thinks you are worthless and a child with all your multi id posts supporting yourself. Just pathetic!
